timeline.bodyText: No need for a hardcoded id, you should probably create a class for this item and do an instanceof check here instead.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Setting the damage is not really good practice, you should rather cancel the event instead (and maybe play a sound effect too?).
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: i tried cancelling... didnt really work for some reason
replies.author: Seggan

replies.bodyText: also what sound effect would u suggest? id think either smth do do with iron or slime
replies.author: Seggan

replies.bodyText: I'd try stepping or breaking bedrock or obsidian sound.
replies.author: LinoxGH

replies.bodyText: confirmed: cancelling event you still die from falling form a high place
replies.author: Seggan

replies.bodyText:
confirmed: cancelling event you still die from falling form a high place

Afaik cancelling death event doesn't cancel the death but only cancels the item drops and etc. This is a bug/feature of Spigot.
replies.author: LinoxGH

replies.bodyText: if you dont die you still take damage
replies.author: Seggan

replies.bodyText:
if you dont die you still take damage

From what I can remember you need to listen to player damage event. It's fired before player dies.
replies.author: LinoxGH

replies.bodyText:
Afaik cancelling death event doesn't cancel the death but only cancels the item drops and etc. This is a bug/feature of Spigot.

I meant cancelling the damage event
